title: This giant creature in the Karthus picture should be a champ

replies.body:
Nothing on Mordekaiser... 

https://i.giphy.com/media/3oAt21Fnr4i54uK8vK/giphy.gif
That should be his ult
I don't think Riot can change Karthus' iconic ultimate.
Famous last words. {{champion:114}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:78}}  and soon{{champion:20}}

Irelia's ult was not even considered an actual spell, let alone an iconic one, and Fiora's the same idea, just better design overall.

Edit: And Galio and Poppy were just toxic for various reasons, those are big enough reasons to change them - and they were not even close to being as iconic as Karthus's ult, that's like one of the three most iconic spells in the entire history of the game.
In what way was Galio's ult ever toxic?  Don't give me any "various reasons" crap either.  I want those actual reasons.

I thought these are well known so I didn't feel the need to name them.

Galio's ult was an AoE CC with an extreme duration and massive damage that also could affect enemies at any point of it's duration. Such a powerful spell caused the rest of his kit to be awful because of power budget (thus his awful pickrate and winrate). That caused Galio being viable only when his Flash (0 mobility) and his ult was up (same case as Annie).

This is why Galio's ult was toxic. Will you trust me with Poppy, look the reasons up or do I need to explain her too?

I played a great deal of both Poppy and Galio. I agree that Poppy's was toxic which is why I didn't mention anything about it. Galio's ult was my favorite ability in the game though. Galio "being weak" had nothing to do with his low play rate because he wasn't weak. His entire kit was strong if you had a brain and didn't spam yourself out of mana. Every champion ever with high mana costs has had low play rate and I have played and enjoyed all of them. I love the reward of powerful abilities when you can manage mana. Galio, Yorick, Poppy, Urgot, Taric, and Sion were all extremely mana hungry before their reworks. The only one who kept that aspect was Taric and to no surprise, he is the only one I still play.

> [{quoted}](name=AlienPrimate,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=FQYa7HZA,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-07-25T16:26:08.492+0000)
>

I believe Riot changed it not so much because it was toxic to deal with like Poppy or Fiora, but cause it was inherently bad design as an Ultimate. It forced you to stand still and take damage, and for those not experienced enough if they placed it wrong they could be less effective, it also didn't help that clicking at the wrong time would cancel it early. It widely split the good Galio players and the mediocre to the point where it made him difficult to maintain balance and placate both ends of the spectrum

Your argument is kind of dumb.  That's like saying Taric's current ult is bad because it is hard to time or Shen's ult is bad because you can get knocked out of it if you use it in front of the enemy.  That's my argument on what makes it a good ultimate.  It is really powerful if used correctly but there is plenty of counterplay to it (don't group up, save cc abilities, pick Braum or Udyr, etc.)  On the pick Braum or Udyr part, there was also a level of mastery on Galio's end.  Don't use your ult on either of them until they have already used their stun on you.

Bad design in my opinion is totally unconditional, braindead gameplay that you can master on your very first use of a champion.  Nasus presses R and whoever he is fighting either dies or runs away (better hope you have multiple dashes or he just withers you).  That is way worse design than Galio's ult ever was.

> [{quoted}](name=AlienPrimate,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=FQYa7HZA,comment-id=000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-07-25T22:42:23.099+0000)
>
> Your argument is kind of dumb.  That's like saying Taric's current ult is bad because it is hard to time or Shen's ult is bad because you can get knocked out of it if you use it in front of the enemy.  That's my argument on what makes it a good ultimate.  It is really powerful if used correctly but there is plenty of counterplay to it (don't group up, save cc abilities, pick Braum or Udyr, etc.)  On the pick Braum or Udyr part, there was also a level of mastery on Galio's end.  Don't use your ult on either of them until they have already used their stun on you.
> 
> Bad design in my opinion is totally unconditional, braindead gameplay that you can master on your very first use of a champion.  Nasus presses R and whoever he is fighting either dies or runs away (better hope you have multiple dashes or he just withers you).  That is way worse design than Galio's ult ever was.

ok but that was only part of my arguement is the rest of my arguement solid?

That's your point of view and it directly contradicts the point of view of everyone else. But hey, I get it, I mained Zyra mid for three years and I would swear she's not weak, every champion can work well enough if mastered but that doesn't just make all the better champions disappear (how many champions could do better than old Galio and without having to care about mana?).

There are no champions who ever had the health sustain Galio had and there probably never will be.  Galio could make every champion disappear in the sustain department but wait...he disappeared because 1% win rate wasn't good enough for Riot I guess.  That's ok though, now he can sit at 46% win rate that he currently has rather than the 52% he had pre-rework.

{{champion:36}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:31}} ? He would run out of mana before these would even get to lane. 

Just don't take it wrong - the rework was a mistake and the problems were just replaced with different ones (he's a perfect overloaded bullshit with no skill floor now, every time his numbers are gonna be slightly good he's gonna be busted).

That's why you just build some mana on champions that require mana.  It's a pretty simple concept.  My build was always {{item:3027}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3110}}  which gave plenty of mana to do what I want with.  My main is now Taric who has massive mana problems.  In top lane my first 2 items are {{item:3070}} {{item:3025}} .  I like to have mana problems when I play because mana problems come with increased power.  They have high mana costs for a reason.  Galio's Q had 300 base damage and ult had 720 base damage.  Of coarse it is going to cost some mana to use.
how come galio and poppy were so toxic and broken nobody even played them?
I literally said it in that post: Riot had to keep them in shit state because of that toxicity. That and they were ugly and Riot's data show that ugly champions see no play.

> [{quoted}](name=Evil Bisex Plant,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=FQYa7HZA,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2018-07-24T22:50:18.847+0000)
>
> Irelia's ult was not even considered an actual spell, let alone an iconic one, and Fiora's the same idea, just better design overall.
> 
> Edit: And Galio and Poppy were just toxic for various reasons, those are big enough reasons to change them - and they were not even close to being as iconic as Karthus's ult, that's like one of the three most iconic spells in the entire history of the game.

how is free and near unmissable/undodgable burst damage on every enemy anywhere on the map without any gating mechanism or otherwise not toxic? Even if it does have a warning and a delay.

New Galio is unbalancable overloaded bullshit and should have never been put into the game, same as new Poppy. 

But that has no value for judging Galio's old kit.

fiora's ult was pretty much just an upgraded alpha strike, noone liked that shit. It was a 1v5 button. not that she's fun to deal with now.

galio's ult is still somewhat there, i don't like his rework's visual side but think the skillset still somewhat resembles his old one.

Poppy is still poppy, i played her before her rework and still play her. Her Dash Q was imo much more iconic and while i wish her Q was still an AD scaling AP nuke her new one still feels good. Her passive is still there. her old ult was kinda iconic but toxic as hell.

> [{quoted}](name=The God of Rams,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=FQYa7HZA,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-07-24T20:56:47.019+0000)
>
> I don't think Riot can change Karthus' iconic ultimate.

I can see why they would want to change it, make it more dynamic. Right now you just need a little map awareness and to do quick maths in your head to see if you can get the kill. I like the impact that Karthuus has on the game. Constantly knowing if you're low hp you aren't safe sells his champ design. Riot may not agree when the VGU him.

> [{quoted}](name=The God of Rams,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=FQYa7HZA,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-07-24T20:56:47.019+0000)
>
> I don't think Riot can change Karthus' iconic ultimate.

but they could tweak it so it more balanced?
WHAT THE HELL IS THAT THING?!?
Probably some form of undead elemental. Elementals are often the purest form of nature given life. This is probably it corrupted.

> [{quoted}](name=The God of Rams,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=FQYa7HZA,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-07-24T20:57:39.096+0000)
>
> Probably some form of undead elemental. Elementals are often the purest form of nature given life. This is probably it corrupted.

I don't think elementals are actually alive, as they're embodiments of natural magics. Since they embody natural magics, and don't possess life like normal creatures, they can't really be affected by the death magics of the Shadow Isles. That thing is most likely some sort of land based leviathan or titanic beast that the Harrowing killed and revived as undead.
Not true, Maokai is an elemental and he only survived due to soaking up and holding the life giving water inside of him.  That means they can definitely be killed and corrupted by the shadow isles.

Maokai isn't an elemental, he's a nature spirit, more specifically a treant. An elemental would be someone like Malphite, who embodies the element of earth and the mountain, should he ever get a lore update, or someone who embodies the pure force of an element, like a creature who's nothing but wind, or another who's just a being composed of water. An elemental is very typically not "living" as we understand it, since they typically do not have bodies composed of anything other than the element they represent.
We don't really know how elementals are treated in League. Blue Buff Golem is probably the closest thing to an elemental we have in-game.
Maybe what happens when a creature from the Void ends up on the Shadow Isles.
Maybe its a sea monster that got brought back to live during the harrorwing
undead brambleback

That's a Lhurgoyf if I've ever seen one. Hide your dead.

https://mtg.gamepedia.com/Lhurgoyf

> [{quoted}](name=RookPusher,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=FQYa7HZA,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-07-24T21:00:24.748+0000)
>
> That's a Lhurgoyf if I've ever seen one. Hide your dead.
> 
> https://mtg.gamepedia.com/Lhurgoyf

What?

They look nothing alike, apart from both being massive.

> [{quoted}](name=Warlord Rhinark,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=FQYa7HZA,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2018-07-24T21:26:39.303+0000)
>
> What?
> 
> They look nothing alike, apart from both being massive.

https://www.ebay.com/itm/TERRAVORE-Odyssey-MTG-Green-Creature-A-Lhurgoyf-RARE-/121189963328

> [{quoted}](name=RookPusher,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=FQYa7HZA,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2018-07-24T22:52:24.709+0000)
>
> https://www.ebay.com/itm/TERRAVORE-Odyssey-MTG-Green-Creature-A-Lhurgoyf-RARE-/121189963328

Still, they don't look that similar.

Terravore's head seems very flat and it's face long, compared to this, what do I call it? Cyclops? The Cyclops' head seems to be the opposite. Tall head with a flat face.

Plus, the Cyclops only has one eye, Terravore has two.

This is not to mention the tentacles sprouting out of the Cyclops back, and the fact that their color schemes don't match at all.

I'm sorry, but this "Lhurgoyf" thing isn't working out for me.
And I agree tho we do nee more monster champs, hopefully Riot figures out how to make them more relatable so they will get played more
Looks like a Crag Beast of Demacia.

> [{quoted}](name=Tesla Effect,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=FQYa7HZA,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2018-07-25T05:56:22.017+0000)
>
> Looks like a Crag Beast of Demacia.

uh whats that? And i just realized they didn't include a "Creatures of Demacia" list im miffed.
Haunted Malphite skin confirmed?
i would love that
Looks just like Kog'Maw to me
maokai?
It looks like one of the monsters from the void that was released in the miny lore update but with a more elemental/ shadow isles theme
yes yes YES YES!
